headline.main: Powerful Rivals Clash Over Sugar Price Supports; The Politics of Sugar

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.abstract: Last article in series notes that coalition of sugar refiners, large indus users and consumers oppose growers' request for higher support prices (L)
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15--When Rowland Cannon, the president of a large sugar beet processing company, appeared before the Senate Finance Committee last May to urge higher support prices for sugar crops, he said that the issue was something more than whether the growers would receive more money. It was whether the industry would survive.
